perturbation.original_text:
Any and all customer data that is collected from the Co-Branded Site shall be
collected and used in accordance with Canadian federal and provincial laws and
U.S. Federal and State laws and both MediaLinx and HCI privacy guidelines and
MediaLinx and HCI shall each own an undivided interest in such data. MediaLinx
will not have access to the HCI Personal Health Records (being the longitudinal
repository of personal health information about users of the Co-Branded Site)
during or after the Term of this Agreement. During the Term of this Agreement
and for a period of six (6) months thereafter, MediaLinx shall not use or
publicly disclose the data collected from users of the Co-Branded Site if such
use is for the purpose of providing health information, advertisements, or
products that compete with those that reside on the Co-Branded Site. In other
instances, MediaLinx shall be entitled to use or publicly disclose the data
collected subject to privacy guidelines noted above.
perturbation.changed_text:
Any and all customer data that is collected from the Co-Branded Site shall be
collected and used in accordance with Canadian federal and provincial laws and
U.S. Federal and State laws and both MediaLinx and HCI privacy guidelines and
MediaLinx and HCI shall each own an undivided interest in such data. MediaLinx
will have access to the HCI Personal Health Records (being the longitudinal
repository of personal health information about users of the Co-Branded Site)
during and after the Term of this Agreement. During the Term of this Agreement
and for a period of six (6) months thereafter, MediaLinx shall always use or
publicly disclose the data collected from users of the Co-Branded Site if such
use is for the purpose of providing health information, advertisements, or
products that compete with those that reside on the Co-Branded Site. In other
instances, MediaLinx shall not be entitled to use or publicly disclose the data
collected subject to privacy guidelines noted above.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that MediaLinx will not have access to HCI Personal Health Records during or after the term of the agreement. It also restricts the use of user data for competitive purposes for six months after the agreement ends. The modified text contradicts this by stating that MediaLinx will have access to HCI Personal Health Records during and after the term, and shall always use or publicly disclose the data collected. This creates uncertainty about the data ownership and usage rights.

perturbation.original_text:
The term of this Agreement shall be for a period of two (2) years (the "Term").
The effective date of the start of the Term will be from the Launch Date.
perturbation.changed_text:
The term of this Agreement shall be for a period of one (1) year (the "Term").
The effective date of the start of the Term will be three months after the Launch Date.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a two-year term beginning on the Launch Date. The modified text shortens the term to one year and delays the start date by three months after the Launch Date. This contradiction creates confusion about the agreement's duration and effective period.

perturbation.original_text:
Subject to paragraph 6, MediaLinx shall be entitled to sell advertising and
sponsorships on all pages of the Co-Branded Site to Canadian advertisers (for
the purposes of this Agreement "Canadian advertisers" shall be advertisers with
substantial places of business in Canada) and HCI shall be entitled to sell
advertising and sponsorships on all pages of the Co-Branded Site to US
advertisers (for the purposes of this Agreement, US advertisers shall be
advertisers with substantial places of business in the United States).
perturbation.changed_text:
Subject to paragraph 6, MediaLinx shall be entitled to sell advertising and
sponsorships on only even pages of the Co-Branded Site to Canadian advertisers (for
the purposes of this Agreement "Canadian advertisers" shall be advertisers with
substantial places of business in Canada) and HCI shall be entitled to sell
advertising and sponsorships on all pages of the Co-Branded Site to US
advertisers (for the purposes of this Agreement, US advertisers shall be
advertisers with substantial places of business in the United States).
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that both MediaLinx and HCI can sell advertising on 'all pages.' By altering it, it is not all pages anymore. This creates confusion about the agreement's terms.
